business.headline: India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as heavyweight stocks gain; Q2 GDP data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 759.05 points to 79,802.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 216.95 points to 24,131.10. Both the indices had declined roughly 1.5% yesterday.

PAN 2.0 FAQs: Who can apply, QR code feature, and other key detailsPAN 2.0 is a government initiative combining PAN and TAN systems with a QR code for secure and quick identity verification, simplifying taxpayer registration and promoting a tech-driven tax ecosystem.

Sensex surges 800 points: Key factors behind bull run on Dalal StreetStock market today: Sensex and Nifty regained their footing, driven by improved investor sentiment and stock-specific action. Read on to find out the key reasons behind today's rebound on Dalal Street.

Enviro Infra makes solid market debut: Should you hold or book profit?Enviro Infra IPO listing: Shares of Enviro Infra Engineers have dipped slightly following their strong listing, prompting investors to weigh whether to hold onto their shares or book profits.

Adani Green, Adani Energy Solutions: Why these Adani Group stocks are gainingAdani Green Energy led the surge, rising 14.64% to hit Rs 1,247.55. Adani Energy Solutions followed, reaching a day's high of Rs 825.85. Most other Adani Group stocks also registered gains in early trade.

Enviro Infra shares make strong debut, list at 49% premium over IPO priceEnviro Infra Engineers listing: The shares opened at Rs 220 on the NSE, marking a 48.64% jump from the IPO price of Rs 148. On the BSE, the stock listed at Rs 218, reflecting a 47.29% premium.

Sensex rallies 700 points, Nifty above 24,000; Adani stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 663 points to reach 79,702.09 by 10:33 am, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 154.60 points to trade at 24,084.95.

Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Cyclone Fengal landfall begins, to cross Tamil Nadu in 3 to 4 hours Live UpdatesThe landfall process of cyclonic storm Fengal has begun near Puducherry. Several airlines have briefly suspended flight operations in Chennai. Follow our live updates.

BJP announces swearing-in date amid Maharashtra Chief Minister deadlockMaharashtra BJP Chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule announced that the oath-taking ceremony of the new government will be held on December 5.

Pakistan ready to accept hybrid Champions Trophy, seeks uniform ICC policy: SourcesThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is reportedly ready to accept the hybrid model for the Champions Trophy if the ICC implements the same model across all ICC events until 2031. With around three months left for the tournament, the schedule is yet to be announced.

Iskcon claims another Hindu priest arrested in Bangladesh, centre vandalisedThe development comes amid widespread protests by Hindus across Bangladesh following the arrest of former Iskcon leader Chinmoy Krishna Das earlier this week on sedition charges.

AAP vs BJP after liquid thrown at Arvind Kejriwal during padyatra in DelhiVisuals showed that a man approached the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) national convenor when he was acknowledging the crowd and hurled a liquid at him, which was supposedly water, sources said.

Telangana student shot dead in Chicago shopping mall, had gone to US 3 months agoThe victim, identified as 22-year-old Sai Teja Nukarapu, was shot at the shopping mall where he had been working part-time.

Doing Bongs wrong: Bollywood's portrayal problemBengali characters in Hindi films often face stereotyping, with their portrayal reduced to clichéd tropes that misrepresent their culture, with Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 being a recent example. Director Srijit Mukherji discusses the need for authentic representation and shares his views on why such stereotypes still appear.

RSS urges Centre to mobilise global support for Hindus in BangladeshRSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale condemned the persecution of Hindus in Bangladesh, accusing the Muhammad Yunus government of being a "silent spectator" to the rising violence against the minority community.

A dating dictionary with 10 trending terms to help you survive modern loveIf you've been away from the dating scene for a while, you might feel lost in a sea of quirky terms. Here's your dating dictionary to navigate the maze of modern love.

Victoria's Secret model kidnapped at gunpoint, held hostage in shack: ReportThe Brazilian model, Luciana Curtis, and her husband were eventually released, but not before a terrifying 12-hour ordeal, which included transferring all their money to the miscreants.

Why India visit of this tech mogul, who wants to live forever, is creating buzzBryan Johnson in India: Tech millionaire Bryan Johnson, who has started a project called 'Blueprint' to find new ways to reverse ageing, is set to visit India this month and it has generated considerable buzz.

Rahul Gandhi's 'cracked the whip' reply to Congress chief's unity call at meetingDuring a CWC meeting held to analyse Congress's defeats in Haryana and Maharashtra, party chief Mallikarjun Kharge said that infighting was hurting the grand old party and urged leaders to stop making anti-party remarks.

Vir Das meets Vikas Khanna, chef hopes actor will host Oscars nextVir Das, an actor and comedian, visited chef Vikas Khanna in New York after hosting the International Emmys, with Khanna sharing their photo and expressing hopes for Das to host the Oscars next.

Josh actor Sharad Kapoor accused of misbehaving with woman, case registeredBollywood actor Sharad Kapoor has been accused of inappropriate behaviour and unwelcome physical contact with a woman at his Mumbai residence. A police case has been registered against him.

Won't treat Bangladeshi patients: Kolkata hospital after insult to Indian flagAn official of the JN Ray Hospital in north Kolkata said the decision was forced by insults meted out to the Indian flag by Bangladeshi nationals.

Detox bars, IV drips: Indian wedding hangovers get a swanky cureWedding planners and modern couples have introduced the ultimate antidote to keep the wedding festivities alive the morning after the party: detox bars and IV drips.

When Jagadish Chandra Bose proved science fiction wasn't just a white man's gameJagadish Chandra Bose wasn't just a pioneer in science -- he broke barriers in science fiction too. In 1896, he broke ground with India's first science fiction work, and in Bengali, taking the genre far beyond the confines of Western imagination.

Worked hard on that monologue, says Vir Das after Emmys speech goes viralVir Das, the first Indian to host the International Emmys, delivered a viral monologue that humorously addressed various global figures and incidents. He expressed gratitude for the positive reception.

Home and office open for you: Priyanka Gandhi's first speech in Wayanad as MPPriyanka Gandhi Vadra portrayed herself as an approachable MP and said the doors of her home and office were open for the people of Wayanad to meet her and share their issues with her.

Video: UP man loads mud on Thar, speeds off on highway, faces legal actionIn the viral video, man can be seen throwing mud at his Mahindra Thar before speeding off on the road. Moments later, he can be seen driving at dangerously high speeds, putting others at risk.

Kalki Koechlin didn't have work for 2 years after DevD, travelled on local trainKalki Koechlin reflected on her early career struggles post-DevD, sharing that she had no work for two years. She used to eat vada pao and travel on local trains to manage her finances.

Trump's defence pick's mother accuses him of mistreating women for years: ReportDonald Trump's Defence Secretary pick Pete Hegseth, known for his conservative stance, has criticised "woke" military leadership, opposed women in combat roles, and questioned the relevance of international war regulations.

Watch: CNN anchor's viral reaction as Trump border czar threatens to jail mayor CNN host Kasie Hunt expressed shock at border czar nominee Tom Homan's assertion that he would jail Democratic Denver Mayor Mike Johnston should he refuse to comply with the Trump administration's deportation plans.

Election Commission invites Congress team over Maharashtra result concerns on Dec 3The Election Commission told the Congress that all poll procedures followed in Maharashtra during the counting of votes were transparent and assured the party that it would review all its legitimate concerns.

Malayalam singer Anju Joseph is married, shares wedding photoMalayalam singer Anju Joseph married Aditya Pareswaram in a court ceremony. She shared the joyous news on Instagram. Videos from her reception are also going viral.

Pics: Diljit Dosanjh rides Kolkata's iconic yellow taxi before it goes off roadDiljit Dosanjh is set to perform in Kolkata today as a part of the Dil-Luminati Tour. Ahead of that, the singer and actor took a trip across the city in the iconic yellow taxi. He also interacted with the locals.

Mohsin Naqvi meets Emirates Board head amid Champions Trophy hybrid model deliberations PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi met Emirates Cricket Board head Mubashir Usmani in Dubai. Naqvi told Usmani that Pakistan was ready to host the Champions Trophy with preparations being on schedule.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
